meanings.definition: Belonging or native to a particular country or region
meanings.sent1: The endemial flowers in the forest are unique to this land.
meanings.sent2: The koala is an endemial species found only in Australia.
meanings.sent3: The endemial birds seemed to have a secret meeting in the trees.
meanings.sent4: The endemial culture of the tribe was like a hidden gem waiting to be discovered.
meanings.sent5: The endemial traditions of the village were passed down through generations.

meanings.definition: Characteristic of a specific area or population
meanings.sent1: The endemial cuisine of the region is known for its spicy flavors.
meanings.sent2: The architecture of the town reflects its endemial style.
meanings.sent3: The endemial fashion trend caught everyone by surprise.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter had an endemial charm that brightened up the room.
meanings.sent5: The endemial music of the band resonated with the local audience.

meanings.definition: Restricted or confined to a certain area or group
meanings.sent1: The endemial rules of the club were strictly followed by all members.
meanings.sent2: The endemial language spoken by the tribe was unfamiliar to outsiders.
meanings.sent3: The endemial party had a surprise guest who added to the excitement.
meanings.sent4: His endemial collection of rare coins was the envy of collectors.
meanings.sent5: The endemial team spirit led them to victory in the tournament.
